description: Erection of six semi-detached houses on land at rear with alterations to number 39 to allow for new access.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (1276/P/5, 1276/P/6, 1276/P/11, Planning Support Statement 8313 dated October 2017prepared by Bell Cornwell LLP, Design and Access Statement dated November 2017 prepared Dusek Design Associates Ltd, Appendix A - Consideration of Renewable Technology prepared by build energy, Air Quality Assessment  ref. AQ1043 dated October 2017 prepared by GEM Air Quality Ltd, Predicted Energy Assessment dated 25 October 2017, DER WorkSheet: New dwelling design stage prepared by build energy, SAP 2012 Overheating Assessment dated 26 October 2017 prepared by build energy, Solar PV Feasibility Table, Energy and Sustainability Statement BE1186 dated 27/10/2017 prepared by build energy and Transport Statement ref. 5001-21258-TJAR-5 dated November 2017 prepared by Turner Jomas &Associates received on 09/11/2017. Typical Section and 1276/P/3A received on 17/01/2018. 1276/P/8A, 1276/P/9A, 1276/P/10A, 1276/P/13 received on 07/02/2018. Stage 1 Road Safety Audit dated February 2018 prepared by Gateway TSP, TER WorkSheet: New dwelling design stage prepared by build energy, Assendum to Energy and Sustainability Statement prepared by build energy, Typical section received on 12/02/2018. 1276/P/2C and 1276/P/P4C received on 27/02/2018.) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - No development shall take place until the demolition shown on approved plan ref. 1276/P/13 'Demolition Plan' has been carried out.

Condition : 4 - Prior to commencement of works above ground level samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the hereby permitted shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details

Condition : 5 - The windows formed at first floor level in the side elevations of the dwellings hereby approved shall be obscure glazed, hinged to open inwards and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than with obscured glazing.

Condition : 6 - No additional windows or other glazed openings shall be formed and no additional doors inserted in any of the dwellings hereby approved without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 7 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 1995 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order) no enlargement of the premises or any additional structures/buildings within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out.

Condition : 8 - Each dwelling hereby approved shall be occupied solely as a single family dwelling within Class C3 of The Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) and shall not be used as a house in multiple occupation, including any use within Class C4 of The Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) or such other legislation as may subsequently supersede it.

Condition : 9 - The waste and recycled materials storage arrangements shown on the approved plans shall be completed before any part of the accommodation hereby permitted is occupied and so maintained at all times thereafter.

Condition : 10 - Prior to commencement of above ground works a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The boundary treatment shall be completed before any of the dwellings are occupied.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and so maintained at all times thereafter.

Condition : 11 - Prior to commencement of development a surface water management strategy shall be submitted to and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The strategy shall include, but not be limited to, the following details:
-	Contains peak flows for the existing site's runoff rates
-	Contains peak flow restriction(s) for the proposed cellular attenuation alternative (if infiltration is unviable) with restrictions to as close to or no more than 3 times Greenfield rates should be demonstrated and explained. 
-	Shows a completed Drainage Assessment Form Section 3.B and 3.C with the Greenfield runoff volume and proposed volumes for both infiltration features or cellular attenuation (and water butts) present. 
-	Clarifies which dimensions and contributing area were used for calculations for all features proposed. Calculations are also needed to show that there is no flooding on-site for the 1 in 30 and 1 in 100 year + climate change rainfall event for both soakaways and permeable paving and cellular attenuation options should be shown. 
-	Comprises a map of the different proposed SuDS features with estimated sizes and how they would link up. 

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and so maintained at all times thereafter.

Condition : 12 - Prior to commencement of development the final detailed drainage designs and associated full drainage maintenance plan shall be submitted to and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the approved details to limit surface water runoff from the site to 5 l/s and so maintained at all times thereafter.

Condition : 13 - The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy and shall not commence above ground until full Design Stage calculations under the Standard Assessment Procedure have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local planning Authority to show that the development will be constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions, and achieved a 35% reduction in emissions on Part L 2013. 
Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure) should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions, and achieved a 35% reduction in emissions on Part L 2013.

Condition : 14 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (schedule of fittings and manufactures literature) should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved internal water use calculations.

Condition : 15 - The development shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts) have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development has been carried out in accordance with the following:
- At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor
finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
- At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
- No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 16 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 18 - Prior to first occupation of any dwelling plans and specifications which detail that at least 20% of the parking spaces hereby approved are provided with EV charging points (capable of 7kW output) and a further 20% supplied with a passive provision. 
The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details prior to first occupation of any dwelling and so maintained at all times thereafter.

Condition : 19 - Notwithstanding the submitted plans full details of the proposed cycle stores, including space to store two bikes for each dwelling, shall be submitted and approved prior to the first beneficial occupation of the dwelling hereby approved and this shall be so maintained at all times thereafter.

Condition : 20 - Nothwithstanding the submitted plans and prior to commencement of above ground works, full details of the access and associated highway works shall be submitted to and agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.
The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to first occupation of any dwelling.

Condition : 21 - Notwithstanding the submitted plans, prior to the commencement of above ground works, details of both hard and soft landscape works shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The works shall then be carried out as approved.
All landscaping comprised in the approved details shall be carried out during the first planting and seeding seasons following completion of construction works. Any trees or shrubs planted (including any such replacements) which die within three years from the date of planting shall be replaced in the next planting season with the same species, and of comparable maturity. The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved and shall be maintained in accordance with the approved management programme.

Condition : 22 - Prior to occupation of any part of the development hereby approved, a splay of 2.4m x 2.4m shall be provided on each side of the access at the junction with Craigwell Avenue the depth measured from the back of the footway and the widths outwards from the edges of the access, and no fence, wall or other obstruction to visibility exceeding 0.6m in height above the surface of the adjoining highway shall be erected within the areas of such splays. The vision splays shall be maintained at all times thereafter.

Condition : 23 - The garages shown on the approved plans shall be provided before the dwelling to which it relates is occupied and thereafter it shall not be used for any purpose other than the parking of vehicles.
